gov.anl.ipns.Util.Sys
Class ColorSelector

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.UI.ActiveJPanel
                      gov.anl.ipns.Util.Sys.ColorSelector
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class ColorSelector
extends ActiveJPanel

This class is a simplified version of the JColorChooser. The advantage of the ColorSelector is the ability to add one or all of the color selectors to a GUI component. Also, the selector uses ActionListeners instead of ChangeListeners to notify listeners of a colorchange.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

COLOR_CHANGED

public static java.lang.String COLOR_CHANGED
"Color Changed" - This message String is sent to all listeners of this class whenever the selected color is changed.

SWATCH

public static int SWATCH
0 - Use this variable to specify the color chooser with swatches. This chooser is ideal when a variety of colors is desired. Using tabbed display, this chooser is under the Swatches tab.

BLEND

public static int BLEND
1 - Use this variable to specify the color chooser with a blended display of colors. This chooser is ideal when a variety of shades of one color is desired. Using tabbed display, this chooser is under the HSB tab.

SLIDER

public static int SLIDER
2 - Use this variable to specify the color chooser that uses sliders to determine amounts of red, green, and blue in a color. This chooser is ideal when a variety of shades of a variety of colors is desired. Using tabbed display, this chooser is under the RGB tab.

TABBED

public static int TABBED
3 - Use this variable to have all of the color choosers displayed in a tabbed layout.

Constructor Detail

ColorSelector

public ColorSelector(int chooser_model)
Constructor - Specify the color model and get a JPanel containing that chooser.

Parameters:
chooser_model - The chooser model desired. Static String constants have been provided by this class to provide options.
Method Detail

getSelectedColor

public java.awt.Color getSelectedColor()
Get the currently selected color of the current color chooser.

Returns:
The currently selected color.

setSelectedColor

public void setSelectedColor(java.awt.Color color)
Used to set the currently selected color of the current color chooser.

Parameters:
color - The new color that will be selected. If this parameter is null, nothing is done.

setModel

public void setModel(int chooser_model)
This method will set the model that will be displayed. This method does not need to be called unless the chooser model type needs to be changed. If the model type needs to change often, consider using the TABBED chooser type.

Parameters:
chooser_model - The chooser model desired. Static String constants have been provided by this class to provide options.

getModel

public int getModel()
This method is used to determine the model that will be displayed for selecting the color.

Returns:
Integer code that specifies which graphical element(s) will be displayed to allow the user to select a color.

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
For testing purposes only.
